---
title: Examples of Old Shókë
---

To do: develop this a bit more and try to push the boundary of what's expressible this way.

| Old Shókë | Gloss | Translation |
|-----------|-------|-------------|
| _Kæt xoma ke shem_ | This night I sleep | I will sleep tonight. Or, _Ke kæt xoma shem_. |
| _Shoke trk mrm-kætr_ | We/us go water-drink | Let's go and drink water. |
| _Ke no mrm shoxtr_ | I him/her water give | I will give him/her water. |
| _Sho tik koch kætr kesh shoxtr_ | You sharp stone take fire make | Take the sharp stone and make fire (strike sparks) |
| _Che che che che che ... shoke nozh thothrk_ che _g&aelig;m_ | No no no no no ... we those mushroom(s) no/not eat | No no no no no ... we are _not_ eating those mushrooms. |
| _Jitjit dhæm shem_ | Bird tree sleep(s) | The bird is sleeping in the tree.
| ... | ... | ... |
